meaning: Scenario label used for output folder names and identification.
Number of time points.
Number of level 1 spatial units.
Number of tree levels (L = 1 means no splitting).
Children per refined node at each split level; length L-1.
Probability a node is refined at each nonterminal level, enabling mixed resolution trees.
Spatial adjacency structure for ICAR simulation.
ICAR precision for spatial effect phi; larger shrinks phi toward 0.
Gamma shape and rate for kappa: kappa ~ Gamma(r_size, r_size). Smaller gives stronger overdispersion.
Dirichlet concentration for omega given q: omega ~ Dirichlet(alpha_dir * q).
Discount factor controlling temporal evolution of lambda_tilde in discount mode.
Shape of Gamma prior for lambda_tilde at time 1: lambda_tilde[1,] ~ Gamma(a0, b0).
Rate of Gamma prior for lambda_tilde at time 1: lambda_tilde[1,] ~ Gamma(a0, b0).
Number of covariates.
constraints: p >= 0; beta_vals must have length p.

meaning: Intercept in log mean model for level 1 risk.
Comma separated regression coefficients of length p.
Standard deviation for covariates x: Normal(0, x_sd^2).
Mean of log exposure: log e ~ Normal(loge_mean, loge_sd^2).
Standard deviation of log exposure.
Extra zero inflation applied after generating y1; with probability zi_prob set y1 to 0.
Time evolution mode for baseline composition q: static, drift, or changepoint.
Change point time index when comp_mode is changepoint.
Strength of change point spike in composition when comp_mode is changepoint.
Drift scale for composition when comp_mode is drift; larger gives faster drift.
Concentration used to initialize baseline composition q at t=1: q ~ Dirichlet(q_conc * 1/K).
Number of Monte Carlo replicates to generate for the scenario.
Base seed for scenario; replicate r uses seed_base + r and offsets for subcomponents.
